definition: to cut out (as a dress)/to cut/to trim/to reduce/to diminish/to cut back (e.g. on staff)/decision/judgment

sentences.english: Yesterday, I decided to get my pants altered .
sentences.chinese: 昨天，我決定往裁縫店改褲子。

sentences.english: Lin Yingying went to two on the road of Yan Yan tailor shop to accept the task.
sentences.chinese: 林嬰嬰可去二馬路上的欣欣裁縫店接受任務。

sentences.english: You work in a clothing shop in the City of Corinth, in Greece,in the year 56.
sentences.chinese: 在希臘哥林多城的裁縫店工作，公元56年。

definition: (idiom) due to an unexpected turn of events
the rice is cooked/what's done is done/it's too late to change anything now (idiom)
pinyin: sheng1 mi3 zhu3 cheng2 shu2 fan4

definition: to be an eyesore/(fig.) to spoil the fun/to be a wet blanket
to parade oneself ostentatiously about town (idiom)
to force sb to buy or sell/to trade using coercion
full moon/first full moon after birth (i.e. entering the second month)
summer sleeping mat (e.g. of woven split bamboo)/CL:張|张[zhang1],領|领[ling3]
short note/slip of paper/stripe/(slang) cop/(old) prostitute
